ANSWER: Based on the diagnosis of streptococcal pharyngitis, I recommend a comprehensive treatment approach that combines evidence-based medical management with patient-centered care strategies. The treatment plan includes initiating a 10-day course of penicillin V (250 mg orally twice daily), along with supportive measures such as rest, hydration, and throat soothing techniques. Close monitoring of symptom progression and airway status will be essential, with a follow-up in 48-72 hours to assess response. Patient education will emphasize medication adherence, recognition of worsening symptoms, and when to seek urgent care. For patients with allergies or intolerance, alternative antibiotics like amoxicillin or cephalexin will be considered. This approach aims to effectively eradicate the infection, alleviate symptoms, prevent complications such as rheumatic fever, and ensure safety given the patient's severity of presentation.
